channel.title: Scaling to the Screen :: K-State CIS 580 Textbook
channel.description: One of the challenges of creating a computer game in the modern day is deciding the resolution you will display the game at. We discussed this previously in our coverage of the game window. But instead of forcing a single resolution, we can instead use a scaling matrix with our SpriteBatch.Begin() call to adapt to the monitor resolution. Let’s begin by assuming we want to display our game full-screen using the monitor’s default resolution.
